column9: There are two versions, one based on the SNES transcript and another based on the SEGA Genesis transcript. Both transcripts are sourced from LLTVG. Kanji-fied version produced with Chat-GPT 4o.
Cards sorted by game stage. Future scenes in earlier stages may appear prematurely.
Some miscellany at the beginning of the deck, but close to ideal afterward.

Based on a translation written by Jason Kunts (x_loto) and hosted on GameFAQs. Item and tool names were spliced in just after the town they're first obtainable in, for a perfect sorting ignoring magic and monster names. Kanji-injected version kudos of Chat-GPT 4o.
Game isn't linear, however, it could be sorted in terms of tutorials, tech or recipes, which ours isn't.

Based on this transcript provided by Nomaki Nayuka(?), hand-written when he originally played the game. Input contains kanji not present in the original, and contains extraneous section markers with the effect of slightly inflating name and location frequencies.

Based on this transcript, assuming a party of Squall, Zell, Irvine. There may be section and name markers that inflate the frequencies of those. Text is sorted by progression order for mandatory dialogue, with a section at the end for random extra conversation.
Subtitles sorted by speaker.

column1: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
column9: Based on a transcript hosted by LLTVG, originally made by Kef Schecter.

column1: The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask
column9: Sourced from zeldalegends.net. (Website is inconsistently down as of August 2024.)

column1: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
column9: Sourced from this dump by David Butler for zeldalegends.net. (Website is inconsistently down as of August 2024.) Sortedness ranked by gpt4o (or at least it tried).

column1: The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker
column9: Sourced from this dump by Iron Knuckle for zeldalegends.net. (Website is inconsistently down as of August 2024.)
Based on an amazing annotated transcript by Mew seeker!

Based on an amazing transcript from LLTVG! Thanks to the English annotations, I was able to accurately splice everything together for a perfect sort. We also have a kanji-injected version (kudos to gpt4o), since the original seemingly had none.

Story deck is sorted and solid, but tutorials and other text are in a separate deck sorted first by category, then by rough time encountered. Metroidvanias don't typically lend themselves to chronological sorting, but still.
Based on a transcript hosted by LLTVG.
Includes all base game and DLC content. Be sure to merge all DLCs into one deck if desired.
Based on a transcript hosted by LLTVG.
Based on a transcript hosted by LLTVG.
Based on a transcript created by Kef Schecter. Kanji-fied version created with Chat-GPT 4o.

Based on an amazing annotated transcript by Mew seeker! Recommended to study only the 'In-Game Combined Kanji' deck and reference the transcript for everything else. (Kanji deck generated from non-kanji text via Chat-GPT 4o. Original non-kanji deck also available.)

Based on an annotated transcript hosted by LLTVG and this 100% playthrough on YouTube. Our deck is sorted meticulously, with input text duplicated to accurately reflect the word count. Our route takes secret paths when they first become available, except for Vanilla Dome's second route which we complete just after Lemmy, and Star Road which we complete just before Bowser's Keep. Kanji-fied version created with help of Chat-GPT 4o.
Based on a brief transcript hosted by LLTVG (maybe 150 words long).
